meanings.definition: (interjection) used to introduce an extraordinary deed or event
meanings.sent1: Shazam! The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent2: Shazam! The superhero saved the day with his incredible powers.
meanings.sent3: Shazam! The cake disappeared in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: Shazam! The unexpected news hit her like a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent5: Shazam! The fireworks lit up the night sky in a spectacular display.

meanings.definition: (verb) to bring about a sudden and dramatic change or transformation
meanings.sent1: She hoped the new paint color would shazam the room into a cozy space.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speaker's words seemed to shazam the audience into action.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand failed to shazam the pumpkin into a carriage.
meanings.sent4: The arrival of the unexpected guest seemed to shazam the party atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise seemed to shazam the dark sky into a canvas of colors.
